name: 'In the Line of Fire' Movie Quiz | In the Line of Fire | 10 Questions

questions.text: What is Clint's character investigating at the start of the film?
questions.explanation:
Counterfeit money.

	He is undercover posing as a possible buyer of counterfeit money. He nearly gets his partner killed.

questions.text: How is Clint first alerted to the threat from John Malkovich's character?
questions.explanation:
His landlady.

	His landlady calls the police after finding a montage of assassination pictures in Malkovich's room.

questions.text: Which of the following names does the Malkovich character NOT use?
questions.explanation:
Oswald.

	McCrawley and Carney are fake identities used by the assassin. Booth is the name (after Lincoln's assassin) he adopts to talk to Horrigan. He rejects Oswald as lacking 'panache'.

questions.text: What is Rene Russo's character's name?
questions.explanation:
Lilly.

	Clint annoys her by pretending he thinks she's a secretary when they first meet.

questions.text: What event or state of events makes it harder for the secret service to protect the President?
questions.explanation:
Re-election campaign.

	It's the President's re-election campaign so he wants to be out and about.

questions.text: Which foreign leader is visiting the President early in the film?
questions.explanation:
President of France.

	Clint's first assignment back on the President's team is to protect him during his tour with the French President.

questions.text: Clint's character is haunted by his duty in Dallas with Kennedy: what other President does he mention working for?
questions.explanation:
Nixon.

	He fell out with Nixon's chief of staff (presumably Haldeman).

questions.text: Where does Clint first spot Malkovich?
questions.correct: In Lafayette Park in Washington, DC
options: In a stadium crowd in Denver
questions.explanation:
In Lafayette Park in Washington, DC.

	They trace one of Booth's phone calls as coming from 'right across the street - he's in Lafayette Park'. They rush out and Clint spots Malkovich dressed as a hippy.

questions.text: Where does the bank clerk, Pam Madsen, come from?
questions.explanation:
Minneapolis.

	She's from Minneapolis which is where 'James Carney' falsely claims is his home city. Bad luck, Pam...

questions.text: How does Malkovich get close to the President?
questions.explanation:
He becomes a political donor.

	He writes a fat cheque to the re-election campaign and gets invited to a dinner for the President.
